list.title: Question 1
list.content:
The subscription fee for an online project management software by
AB-Tech is$40\$ 40$40per month. If the customer buys for a whole year in
advance, a discount of$130\$130$130is applied.This can be modelled by the following function,P(n)P(n)P(n), which gives the
total cost when paying annually for the subscription.P(n)=40n−130,n≥12P(n) = 40n - 130,\quad n\geq 12P(n)=40n−130,n≥12wherennnis the number months.Find the total cost of buying a subscription for222years.[2]FindP−1(1790)P^{-1}(1790)P−1(1790).[2]The subscription price for a different online project management tool by
YZ-tech is$35\$35$35per month, however customers can only purchase
annually in advance, and there are no discounts. The total subscription
cost of YZ-tech's software is less than AB-tech's software whenn>kn>kn>k.Find the minimum value ofkkk.[3]
list.markScheme:
Substitutingn=24n=24n=24into theP(n)P(n)P(n)function, we getP(n)=40n−130P(24)=40(24)−130=$830\begin{aligned}
P(n) &=40n-130\\[6pt]
P(24) &= 40(24)-130 \\[6pt]
&\hspace{0.5em}\answer{=\$ 830}\end{aligned}P(n)P(24)​=40n−130=40(24)−130=$830​​Let's denoteP(n)P(n)P(n)byyyy. To find the inverse we can interchange
the variablesnnnandyyyand rearrange foryyy, as followsy=40n−130n=40y−13040y=n+130y=n+13040P−1(n)=n+13040\begin{aligned}
y &= 40n-130 \\[6pt]
n&=40y-130\\[6pt]
40y&=n+130\\[6pt]
y&=\dfrac{n+130}{40}\\[6pt]
P^{-1}(n) &= \dfrac{n+130}{40}\end{aligned}yn40yyP−1(n)​=40n−130=40y−130=n+130=40n+130​=40n+130​​We can now findP−1(1790)P^{-1}(1790)P−1(1790)as followsP−1(1790)=1790+13040P−1(1790)=48months\begin{aligned}
P^{-1}(1790)&=\dfrac{1790+130}{40}\\[6pt]
&\hspace{-3.5em}\answer{P^{-1}(1790)=48 \text{ months}}\end{aligned}P−1(1790)​=401790+130​P−1(1790)=48months​​For AB-tech's software we we were given the pricing functionP(n)=40n−130P(n)=40n-130P(n)=40n−130For YZ-tech, we can define the function,S(n)S(n)S(n), to
represent the subscription price for their softwareS(n)=35nS(n)=35nS(n)=35n

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/2b908e8c-786e-4fec-844c-19b9653ea308/images/7386b1f2-6825-49b7-88df-da2a1e5501e7/7402d7e1fc9d51e4e9f6b0f5ea74f75143d1438e.svg)

From the graph,S(n)<P(n)S(n) < P(n)S(n)<P(n)forn>26n>26n>26.The price of YZ-tech's software is less than AB-tech's whenn>26n>26n>26.Therefore,k=26\answer{k=26}k=26​

list.title: Question 2
list.content:
The circumference,CCC, of a given circle can be represented by the
functionC(A)=2πAπ,A≥0,\begin{aligned}
C(A) &= 2\pi\sqrt{\dfrac{A}{\pi}}, \hspace{0.5em} A \geq 0,\end{aligned}C(A)​=2ππA​​,A≥0,​whereAAAis the area of the circle.The graph of the functionCCC, for0≤A≤240 \leq A \leq 240≤A≤24, is shown below.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/0b7df521-ef1b-4c8a-87b1-32e564791325/images/ce866e5f-cd7d-44ed-9b43-19469f4d4737/3388e210bb4d6f02426816cb2651396f2822c4c1.svg)

Find the value ofC(24)C(24)C(24).[1]On the grid above, draw the graph of the inverse function,C−1C^{-1}C−1.[3]In the context of the question, explain the meaning ofC−1(2π)=πC^{-1}(2\pi) = \piC−1(2π)=π.[1]
list.markScheme:
EvaluatingC(A)C(A)C(A)forA=24A = 24A=24, we getC(A)=2π24π≈17.4\begin{aligned}
C(A) &= 2\pi\sqrt{\dfrac{24}{\pi}} \\[6pt]
&\answer{\approx 17.4}\end{aligned}C(A)​=2ππ24​​≈17.4​​If we draw the graph of the inverse function,C−1C^{-1}C−1, on the grid
below, we have

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/0b7df521-ef1b-4c8a-87b1-32e564791325/images/3b17f6c6-ed96-4a9a-b40e-195870b66409/fae26733051cc1a7c15c3478abb0d0697e69d7fa.svg)

For a given circle, when the circumference is2π, the area isπ\answer{\text{For a given circle, when the circumference is \(2\pi\), the area is \(\pi\)}}For a given circle, when the circumference is 2π, the area isπ​

list.title: Question 3
Question 4
list.content:
The perimeter,PPP, of a given rectangle can be represented by the
functionP(A)=6A2,A≥0,\begin{aligned}
P(A) &= 6\sqrt{\dfrac{A}{2}}, \hspace{0.5em} A \geq 0,\end{aligned}P(A)​=62A​​,A≥0,​whereAAAis the area of the rectangle.The graph of the functionPPP, for0≤A≤240 \leq A \leq 240≤A≤24, is shown below.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ab39cb62-6642-463f-8d55-b3b4e61d9fc1/images/d77d8ca4-60bf-47df-b71e-f5b1a82ac6ef/13be64c3a363091e834dcc3848fda5575c4c9b07.svg)

Find the value ofP(24)P(24)P(24).[1]On the grid above, draw the graph of the inverse function,P−1P^{-1}P−1.[3]In the context of the question, explain the meaning ofP−1(12)=8P^{-1}(12) = 8P−1(12)=8.[1]
list.markScheme:
EvaluatingP(A)P(A)P(A)forA=24A = 24A=24, we getP(A)=6242≈20.8\begin{aligned}
P(A) &= 6\sqrt{\dfrac{24}{2}} \hspace{0.6em}  \\[6pt]
&\answer{\approx 20.8}\end{aligned}P(A)​=6224​​≈20.8​​If we draw the graph of the inverse function,P−1P^{-1}P−1, on the grid
below, we have

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ab39cb62-6642-463f-8d55-b3b4e61d9fc1/images/ff3fed55-9366-4196-a9da-e2951114048a/0d0a8ad4bbd75e6a6d48466c8f25e5a869af08fe.svg)

For a given rectangle, when the perimeter is12, the area is8\answer{\text{For a given rectangle, when the perimeter is \(12\), the area is \(8\)}}For a given rectangle, when the perimeter is 12, the area is 8​

list.title: Question 5
list.content:
The area,AAA, of a given square can be represented by the functionA(P)=P216,P≥0,\begin{aligned}
A(P) &= \dfrac{P^2}{16}, \hspace{0.5em} P \geq 0,\end{aligned}A(P)​=16P2​,P≥0,​wherePPPis the perimeter of the square.The graph of the functionAAA, for0≤P≤200 \leq P \leq 200≤P≤20, is shown below.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/d67d010e-f96a-4959-94d7-dd830ba69f41/images/db5dae3b-4d37-46d8-a488-586d1cdc2312/8c2c1a298c1b79e92e64f94fe2b4a4d452e488ad.svg)

Find the value ofA(20)A(20)A(20).[1]On the grid above, draw the graph of the inverse function,A−1A^{-1}A−1.[3]In the context of the question, explain the meaning ofA−1(4)=8A^{-1}(4) = 8A−1(4)=8.[1]
list.markScheme:
EvaluatingA(P)A(P)A(P)forP=20P = 20P=20, we getA(P)=20216=25\begin{aligned}
A(P) &= \dfrac{20^2}{16} \hspace{1.7em} \\[6pt]
&\answer{= 25}\end{aligned}A(P)​=16202​=25​​If we draw the graph of the inverse function,A−1A^{-1}A−1, on the grid
below, we have

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/d67d010e-f96a-4959-94d7-dd830ba69f41/images/8288a0de-f259-43ef-a694-da2f13679dc3/508588bd8662a40575516587374d1e3379be6249.svg)

For a given square, when the area is4, the perimeter is8\answer{\text{For a given square, when the area is \(4\), the perimeter is \(8\)}}For a given square, when the area is 4, the perimeter is 8​

list.title: Question 6
list.content: A function is defined byg(x)=3−12x+3g(x)=3-\dfrac{12}{x+3}g(x)=3−x+312​for−9≤x≤9-9\leq x\leq 9−9≤x≤9,x≠−3x\neq -3x=−3Find the range ofggg.[3]Find the value ofg−1(0)g^{-1}(0)g−1(0).[2]
list.markScheme:
The graph ofg(x)=3−12x+3g(x)=3-\dfrac{12}{x+3}g(x)=3−x+312​is plotted below.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/616164a4-faa5-4676-9f3c-4769c3d41be8/images/23cbcbe8-15fc-47be-83cd-0d50dcfbc06b/AI881a.PNG)

From the graph, the range ofgggis(−∞,2]∪[5,∞)]\answer{(-\infty,2]\cup[5,\infty)]}(−∞,2]∪[5,∞)]​g−1(0)g^{-1}(0)g−1(0)corresponds to the value ofxxxwheng(x)=0g(x)=0g(x)=0.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/616164a4-faa5-4676-9f3c-4769c3d41be8/images/47112aa7-51a3-49b0-9ae0-889a5f78ea51/AI881b.PNG)

From the graph,g(x)=0g(x)=0g(x)=0whenx=1x=1x=1. Hence,g−1(0)=1\begin{aligned}
\answer{g^{-1}(0)=1}
\end{aligned}g−1(0)=1​​

list.title: Question 7
list.content:
A function is defined byf(x)=x+1x2−4f(x)=\dfrac{\sqrt{x+1}}{x^2-4}f(x)=x2−4x+1​​, for the
domain−1≤x≤5-1\leq x\leq 5−1≤x≤5,x≠2x\neq 2x=2Find the range offff.[4]Find the value off−1(25)f^{-1}\left(\dfrac{2}{5}\right)f−1(52​).[2]

list.title: Question 8
list.content: A function is defined byf(x)=x+5f(x)=\sqrt{x+5}f(x)=x+5​,x≥−5x\geq -5x≥−5Determine the domain and range offff.[3]Find the value off−1(6)f^{-1}(\sqrt{6})f−1(6​).[2]
list.markScheme:
The graph off(x)=x+5f(x)=\sqrt{x+5}f(x)=x+5​is plotted below.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/8ae200fc-c8c2-45b4-aa13-f0e9f279cb9a/images/881074fb-10d0-4145-9bf1-ee5c090fa571/1805e337e073512237286acb5583906bdf31bb84.svg)

From the graph, the domain offffis[−5,∞)\answer{[-5,\infty)}[−5,∞)​and the range offffis[0,∞)\answer{[0,\infty)}[0,∞)​f−1(6)f^{-1}(\sqrt{6})f−1(6​)corresponds to the value ofxxxwhenf(x)=6f(x)=\sqrt{6}f(x)=6​.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/8ae200fc-c8c2-45b4-aa13-f0e9f279cb9a/images/5e47c30a-f23c-47d5-b947-709f7668078d/7c19742e74bbe79b3eeb3b8509335ac2df5057a0.svg)

From the graph,f(x)=6f(x)=\sqrt{6}f(x)=6​whenx=1x=1x=1. Hence,f−1(6)=1\answer{f^{-1}(\sqrt{6})=1}f−1(6​)=1​
